English.Text: You are led a merry dance. It transpires the Queen has made several visits to family in the region, staying very briefly at each estate before being driven on to the next with her modest retinue. You try to puzzle the ultimate purpose of this, but can deduce nothing, and must go around the houses before you arrive exhausted at the ivy-clad castle of Consort Prince Ernest. His nervous disposition suggests he knows the Queen's intentions in visiting.
